Articles.Content:
4 years ago, in the first year of the kerbal space program, a new spacecraft was unveiled. The spacecraft was called Pulsar and flew on the KLS rocket.

![XbqCveq.png](http://i.imgur.com/XbqCveq.png)

The first 4 PCL(Pulsar Crew Launch) missions went perfect, and then PCL-5 launched. Its mission was an elliptical Kerbin orbit to research the differences in space as they got farther. The mission lasted 10 days and ended in failure when a computer problem caused the parachute to deploy during reentry, the heat destroying it.

![TfSCFO9.png](http://i.imgur.com/TfSCFO9.png)

![Tm1RHG4.png](http://i.imgur.com/Tm1RHG4.png)

![A6WZqWw.png](http://i.imgur.com/A6WZqWw.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-09-01T00:37:44Z" title="09/01/2015 12:37  AM" data-short="8 yr">September 1, 2015</time> by Voyager275**
The Kerbals are dead. Long live the Kerbals ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
Moving this mission report over to Mission Reports.
